question.questionA: Flowers sessile in elongated spikes.
question.questionB: Flowers on pedicels in clusters or rounded heads.

question.questionA: Flowers in dense, two- to four-ranked spikes; fruit smooth.
question.questionB: Flowers in whorls, forming a leafy spike.

question.questionA: Woody-based perennials; leaves and bracts glaucous, with white margins;  leaves  leathery,  spine-tipped;  bracts  overlapping,  forming quadrangular spikes; flowers bright yellow, exceeding the bracts.
question.questionB: Herbaceous annuals; leaves green; flowers pale yellow, scarcely exceeding the bracts.

question.questionA: Upper leaves narrowly linear; spike lax; bracts not overlapping.
question.questionB: Upper leaves lanceolate; spike dense; bracts overlapping.

question.questionA: Upper stem bristly; leaf tips acute; fruit bristly at the top.
question.questionB: Upper stem softly hairy; leaf tips blunt; fruit beaked.

question.questionA: Fruit a fleshy berry; corolla usually five-lobed.
question.questionB: Fruit dry; seeds one or two; corolla four- or five-lobed.

question.questionA: Stems tough; leaves ovate-elliptical, dark green, shining.
question.questionB: Stems brittle; leaves narrowly linear, margins revolute, light green, not shining.

question.questionA: Corolla tube usually at least twice as long as lobes.
question.questionB: Corolla tube shorter than lobes.

question.questionA: Calyx teeth four to six, distinct, persistent in fruit.
question.questionB: Calyx teeth four, very short, caducous.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts inconspicuous; flowers pink.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts exceeding inflorescence; flowers blue.

question.questionA: Flowers purple or red.
question.questionB: Flowers white or yellow.

question.questionA: Stoloniferous perennials;  corolla  1-2 mm, purplish pink; fruit not bristly.
question.questionB: Annuals; corolla minute, purple; fruit covered in fine bristles.

question.questionA: Flowers yellow.
question.questionB: Flowers white.

question.questionA: Perennials, longest leaves exceeding internodes; inflorescence dense.
question.questionB: Annuals, leaves much shorter than internodes; inflorescence lax.

question.questionA: Stoloniferous perennials.
question.questionB: Non-stoloniferous annuals.

question.questionA: Leaves yellowish green; petals beaked.
question.questionB: Leaves glaucous; petals apiculate.

question.questionA: Stems sparsely prickled; cymes three-flowered, lateral  male, central hermaphrodite; fruit warty.
question.questionB: Stems markedly rough with recurved prickles on the angles; fruits not warty.

question.questionA: Fruits globular, wider than corolla, single-seeded, granular with soft papillae; peduncles strongly recurved in fruit.
question.questionB: Fruits usually didymous, narrower than corolla, two-seeded, non-granular; peduncles erect in fruit.

question.questionA: Inflorescences many-flowered; corolla pure white.
question.questionB: Inflorescences few-flowered; corolla greenish white.

question.questionA: Petals greenish inside, reddish outside; fruit glabrous or finely papillose with curved hairs.
question.questionB: Petals greenish white throughout; fruit with hooked bristles.

question.questionA: Stems 15-120 cm; leaves 12-50 mm, six to eight in a whorl; fruits covered with hooked bristles.
question.questionB: Stems up to 20 cm; leaves 4-8 mm, four to six in a whorl; fruits with hooked bristles at the apex and along the lower margins.
